pros: great environment, I enjoyed the work, great people, and very laid back atmosphere.  my co-workers were great and always willing to teach you new things.
cons: I worked as a graduate assistant, and obviously, there was an end to my employment when I graduated.   I have tried to apply for several positions since I graduated, and get no response.  I always received very positive reviews and feedback from my supervisors and they gladly serve as my references.  It is disheartening that Bradley doesn't seem to value their graduates when filling position.

pros: The institution is student-focused and has a classic liberal arts feel to it. Politics are relatively minimal, and the organizational structure is accessible to members of all levels.
cons: Money. Pay is not up to standard for professional staff. Individuals with nearly 20 years of experience and a graduate-level degree have still not surpassed $40k annual salary. Limited growth potential in a number of areas across campus.

review_title: Great student experience, okay staff experience
pros: The faculty and students are amazing to work with.  I cannot speak highly enough of the faculty in the college of business.
cons: Lots of disgruntled staff across campus and weird politics can make it tough to work cross-departmentally, plus as with any academic institution, bureaucracy slows everything down.

pros: Bradley University is an excellent 6,000–7,000 student private university with a diverse population dedicated to learning. The smaller class sizes at Bradley promote a rich learning environment. Bradley is full of good professors who really care about their students. Bradley is a great university in a place without a lot of distractions.
cons: Located in the Heart of Illinois; Peoria, Illinois; Bradley is not located in what you would call a mecca of the arts and culture. Nightlife consists mostly of small bars. Could do with more entertainment.

pros: My advisor was incredibly understanding of my varying, often intense academic and co-curricular schedule.  They were willing to work with me as much as possible to make sure that I maintained a high GPA and solid involvement in organizations outside of the classroom while still holding me accountable.
cons: It is a part time student employee position so there really are no benefits and the pay is minimum wage.

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Peoria, IL
pros: I strongly believe that Bradley has a lot to do to make the position of Graduate Research Assistant attractive even given the fact that it comes with scholarship.
cons: We received our assignments rather late. The problem comes when you get to work for a professor that just uses you as a copy machine and does not let you grow.

pros: Relaxed atmosphere, direct work with students
cons: HUGE overturn rate of faculty and staff. Only the people in charge of determining raises get them, and there's no sense of community when you work there. Not to mention that to change anything takes outrageous amounts of time because of all of the hoops you need to jump through. We would always joke about flying at "the speed of bureaucracy."

job_title: Student Admissions Representative in Mount Prospect, IL
pros: Flexible and easy scheduling for shifts, as well as making changes and substitutions, administration understands the time requirements of being a student
cons: Some of the organization and planning feels like it could be improved (last second changes or confusion during events) but employee input on improvements feels insulated from the process of being implemented.

pros:
It was great to work on a compact campus like Bradley. There are some beautiful buildings and landscaping, and you get to be out moving around at times rather than sitting at a desk all day.
The medical benefits, time off, flexibility and ability to take classes for a large discount were great. Getting paid only once a month took some getting used to, but didn't bother me.
cons: No cons jump out at me

review_title: Budget prevents many raises and has been at minimum wage the past 4 years.
pros: If you are a student, it is hard to beat walking to work in 5 minutes.
cons: The minimum wage and broken up hours make it difficult to make any money while working as a student.

pros: Alumni association is very strong
cons: As a small private liberal arts university dependent on an expensive tuition, it is very vulnerable to the changing climate towards higher education. Not ready for remote learning. Presently in a poor position to adapt. Very little diversity. Uninvolved in the community where it is located.

pros: Easy to navigate, easy to learn responsibilities and management is fairly helpful. I worked on the Scout, in admissions, in the student resource center, library, and cafeteria. Lots of chances to make money if you know where to look.
cons: I was never really paid enough :-/ and sometimes it can be easy for them to lose track of you in the system depending on your job.

pros: Was paid fairly for the work I did, was only a student worker so there is not much to say
cons: I can't think of any negative experiences at the university in regards to employment, once again I did not get the full experience of full time employees

review_title: Student manager of dining services for Bradley university
pros: The hours are flexible and the shifts are not long. Also, you receive meal benefits with five free a week which is a nice incentive.
cons: Your student staff may be unreliable and union workers may make your job harder. Also, you may be responsible for working stations you are not assigned to if student or union does not show up.

job_title: Assistant Director of Admission in Peoria, IL
pros: Great team of reps - Amazing cross-campus communication and updates - Faculty are ready and willing to help out with admission needs - President is one of the best in the NATION!
cons: Pay is questionable - Ultimately I think this is what leads to the turnover

job_title: Student Admissions Representative in Peoria, IL
pros: I was mostly pleased with my experience in the Admissions Office. It was a great place to meet people and network, as well as a great way to get hands on experience in admissions.
cons: There was a lot of work that was redundant and some of it was purposeless. I also did not like the amount of paperwork involved.

pros: Good hour and work life balance. Got good experience as a student to help further my career development
cons: Sometimes upper management can be stagnant and refuses to look at new ideas as possible improvements

pros: Great experience. You understand topics much better when you're teaching another person.  The person I reported to was polite. You get to work when you want to, which is huge. The tutoring center was nice in my opinion.
cons: Not really any cons. Since it was a school job, I understand it being minimum wage.

pros: Flexible hours: I could do the research at the times I wanted to, decent pay, good learning experience: work was independent, allowing me to figure out and understand problems.
cons: I had no bad experience working as a research assistant at Bradley University, but work could get boring if you aren't interested in the topic.

pros: Being a coach for the Bradley University Speech Team is one the most rewarding things I have ever done and the schedule is flexible.
cons: A lot of traveling but tournaments are optional and you make your own hours.

review_title: Overall, the people and customers make this a worthwhile job and institution.
pros: People are great to work with on a daily basis. A little bit of travel.
cons: No room for promotion. People are rarely promoted from within. Compensation is low but it's also a non-profit organization (it's expected).
